messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the cpython program, here is the asan report

The sanitizer detected a heap use after free vulnerability. The explanation of the vulnerability is: Memory is accessed after it has been freed, leading to undefined behavior and security risks. Here is the detail: 

READ of size 8 at 0x50700014cfc8 thread T0
    - Py_TYPE Include/object.h:333:16
    - long_richcompare Objects/longobject.c:3265:5
    - do_richcompare Objects/object.c:922:15
    - PyObject_RichCompare Objects/object.c:965:21
    - PyObject_RichCompareBool Objects/object.c:987:11
    - deque_index_impl Modules/_collectionsmodule.c:1222:15
    - deque_index Modules/clinic/_collectionsmodule.c.h:248:20
    - method_vectorcall_FASTCALL Objects/descrobject.c:401:24
    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:168:11
    - PyObject_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:327:12
    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:815:23
    - _PyEval_EvalFrame Include/internal/pycore_ceval.h:115:16
    - _PyEval_Vector Python/ceval.c:1788:12
    - PyEval_EvalCode Python/ceval.c:592:21
    - run_eval_code_obj Python/pythonrun.c:1294:9
    - run_mod Python/pythonrun.c:1379:19
    - pyrun_file Python/pythonrun.c:1215:15
    - _PyRun_SimpleFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:464:13
    - _PyRun_AnyFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:77:15
    - pymain_run_file_obj Modules/main.c:357:15
    - pymain_run_file Modules/main.c:376:15
    - pymain_run_python Modules/main.c:628:21
    - Py_RunMain Modules/main.c:707:5
    - pymain_main Modules/main.c:737:12
    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:761:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12

0x50700014cfc8 is located 56 bytes inside of 72-byte region [0x50700014cf90,0x50700014cfd8)
freed by thread T0 here:
    - _PyMem_RawFree Objects/obmalloc.c:84:5
    - _PyMem_DebugRawFree Objects/obmalloc.c:2398:5
    - _PyMem_DebugFree Objects/obmalloc.c:2531:5
    - PyObject_Free Objects/obmalloc.c:995:5

    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:4914:13
    - _PyEval_EvalFrame Include/internal/pycore_ceval.h:115:16
    - _PyEval_Vector Python/ceval.c:1788:12
    - _PyFunction_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:413:16
    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:168:11
    - vectorcall_unbound Objects/typeobject.c:2271:12
    - slot_tp_richcompare Objects/typeobject.c:8983:21
    - do_richcompare Objects/object.c:916:15
    - PyObject_RichCompare Objects/object.c:965:21
    - PyObject_RichCompareBool Objects/object.c:987:11

    - PyObject_Vectorcall Objects/call.c:327:12
    - _PyEval_EvalFrameDefault Python/generated_cases.c.h:815:23

previously allocated by thread T0 here:
    - _PyMem_RawMalloc Objects/obmalloc.c:56:12
    - _PyMem_DebugRawAlloc Objects/obmalloc.c:2331:24
    - _PyMem_DebugRawMalloc Objects/obmalloc.c:2364:12
    - _PyMem_DebugMalloc Objects/obmalloc.c:2516:12

    - _PyObject_VectorcallTstate Include/internal/pycore_call.h:166:16

    - _PyRun_AnyFileObject Python/pythonrun.c:77:15
    - pymain_run_file_obj Modules/main.c:357:15
    - pymain_run_file Modules/main.c:376:15
    - pymain_run_python Modules/main.c:628:21
    - Py_RunMain Modules/main.c:707:5
    - pymain_main Modules/main.c:737:12
    - Py_BytesMain Modules/main.c:761:12
    - main Programs/python.c:15:12


To fix this issue, follow the advice below:

1. Set pointers to NULL immediately after freeing them to prevent accidental reuse.
2. Ensure that each allocated memory block is freed only once.
3. Track memory allocations and deallocations systematically to prevent use-after-free conditions.
4. Consider swap the order of freeing memory and accessing it.

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 950 to line 990 in Objects/object.c:
950| PyObject *
951| PyObject_RichCompare(PyObject *v, PyObject *w, int op)
952| {
953|     PyThreadState *tstate = _PyThreadState_GET();
954| 
955|     assert(Py_LT <= op && op <= Py_GE);
956|     if (v == NULL || w == NULL) {
957|         if (!_PyErr_Occurred(tstate)) {
958|             PyErr_BadInternalCall();
959|         }
960|         return NULL;
961|     }
962|     if (_Py_EnterRecursiveCallTstate(tstate, " in comparison")) {
963|         return NULL;
964|     }
965|     PyObject *res = do_richcompare(tstate, v, w, op);
966|     _Py_LeaveRecursiveCallTstate(tstate);
967|     return res;
968| }
969| 
970| /* Perform a rich comparison with integer result.  This wraps
971|    PyObject_RichCompare(), returning -1 for error, 0 for false, 1 for true. */
972| int
973| PyObject_RichCompareBool(PyObject *v, PyObject *w, int op)
974| {
975|     PyObject *res;
976|     int ok;
977| 
978|     /* Quick result when objects are the same.
979|        Guarantees that identity implies equality. */
980|     if (v == w) {
981|         if (op == Py_EQ)
982|             return 1;
983|         else if (op == Py_NE)
984|             return 0;
985|     }
986| 
987|     res = PyObject_RichCompare(v, w, op);
988|     if (res == NULL)
989|         return -1;
990|     if (PyBool_Check(res))

1221|         item = b->data[index];

1242| /* insert(), remove(), and delitem() are implemented in terms of
1243|    rotate() for simplicity and reasonable performance near the end
1244|    points.  If for some reason these methods become popular, it is not
1245|    hard to re-implement this using direct data movement (similar to
1246|    the code used in list slice assignments) and achieve a performance
1247|    boost (by moving each pointer only once instead of twice).
1248| */
